senses.de: A report or description of an event or experience
senses.ex: Her account of the accident is different from yours.

Tips.title: Perspective Matters
Tips.description: Different people may give differing accounts of the same event, showing their perspective.
Tips.example: Eyewitnesses gave varying accounts of the incident.

Tips.title: Detailed Descriptions
Tips.description: An account can be a detailed narrative about experiences or events.
Tips.example: She gave a vivid account of her journey through the mountains.

Tips.title: Figurative Expressions
Tips.description: 'On account of' means because of something.
Tips.example: School was canceled on account of the snow.

senses.de: An arrangement with a bank to keep your money there and to allow you to take it out when you need to
senses.ex: I paid the cheque into my account

Tips.title: Financial Storage
Tips.description: In a financial context, an account is where money is kept for safety and future use.
Tips.example: She has the majority of her funds in a savings account.

Tips.title: Transaction Accessibility
Tips.description: Accounts allow you to deposit and withdraw money.
Tips.example: He withdrew some cash from his checking account.

Tips.title: Various Types
Tips.description: There are different types of accounts for specific purposes, like savings or checking.
Tips.example: I'm transferring money to my checking account.

senses.de: An arrangement with a store or a business, where you can buy goods or services now and pay for them later
senses.ex: We have an account at the local grocery store

Tips.title: Deferred Payment
Tips.description: A store account allows you to pay for goods or services at a later time.
Tips.example: They offered to put the charges on my store account.

Tips.title: Credit Relationship
Tips.description: Having an account with a business can establish a credit relationship.
Tips.example: Our long-standing account with the supplier secured us a discount.

senses.de: To consider or regard in a specified way
senses.ex: His parents account him a genius.

Tips.title: Personal Perception
Tips.description: To account something means regarding it from a personal or collective viewpoint.
Tips.example: The teacher accounts the new policy as essential.

Tips.title: Implicit Value
Tips.description: This verb form can suggest an evaluation of worth or importance.
Tips.example: She's accounted an expert in her field.

senses.de: To provide a report or explanation for something
senses.ex: You will be asked to account for your actions

Tips.title: Explanation Required
Tips.description: To account for something means to explain or justify it.
Tips.example: How do you account for the missing funds?

Tips.title: Contextual Reasoning
Tips.description: Using 'account for' can indicate a cause or reason behind an event or action.
Tips.example: The bad weather accounts for the traffic delay.

Chronicle.wordDefinition:
Chronicle refers to a historical record of events that have occurred over a period of time.

It is usually a detailed and comprehensive record of events. For example, a chronicle of the American Revolution would detail the events leading up to and during that period in history.

An account is a record of a single event or incident, while a chronicle is a historical record of events that have occurred over a period of time.

Description.wordDefinition:
Description is more often used when talking about describing something or someone. It refers to a statement or an account that describes the characteristics, features, or qualities of a particular thing or person.

For example, a job description describes the duties and responsibilities of a particular job.

Account is used to talk about financial records or reports, while description is used to talk about statements or accounts that describe something or someone.

Explanation.wordDefinition:
An explanation is a description or reason given for something that has happened or a particular behavior.

It is used when there is a need to clarify or justify an action or decision. An explanation provides a reason or understanding for why something has occurred.

The main difference between the words account and explanation is that an account provides a factual summary while an explanation provides a reason or justification for something.

History.wordDefinition:
Account refers to your current financial status, while the word history refers to your past transactions. For instance, your bank account is your current financial status, while your transaction history shows what you have bought or sold in the past.

In general terms, an account tracks your current situation, while history documents your past activities.

Narrative.wordDefinition:
Narrative refers to a story or a description of events, often used in literary or creative contexts. It is applicable when one wants to tell a story or describe a situation in a way that is interesting or engaging.

In simpler terms, account is a straightforward report of something that happened, while narrative is a more creative and engaging way of describing the same thing.

Recital.wordDefinition:
Recital refers to a performance or rendition of something like a poem, music, or dance.

Account is used in the context of facts and figures, while recital is used in the context of performance and artistic expression.

Report.wordDefinition:
A report is a written or spoken description of a situation, event, or series of events.

An account is used when referring to financial or administrative matters, whereas a report is usually used to summarize and communicate information about a broader range of topics.

Accounts are usually more detailed and specific, while reports tend to be more general and descriptive.

For example, a bank would keep accounts for each of its customers detailing their financial transactions, while a journalist would write a report on a news event such as a political election.

Story.wordDefinition:
A story is a narrative about events, often including characters and a plot, that may be fictional or based on real-life experiences.

Stories are used to entertain, educate, or inspire, and often involve elements of conflict or resolution.

An account is more fact-based and straightforward, while a story is more creative and imaginative. Accounts are applicable in situations that require objective reporting, while stories can be used in various settings to engage and entertain audiences.

Version.wordDefinition:
Version typically refers to a particular form or edition of something.

To summarize, account refers to a personal profile, while version refers to a particular form or edition of something.

quotes.Text: I'm only going to stand before God and give an account for my life, not for somebody else's life. If I have a bad attitude, then I need to say there's no point in me blaming you for what's wrong in my life.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: If we take into account the existence of our planet, we have to recognise that we are guests that spend a short and very determined period in this world, and all we leave behind is nuclear waste.
quotes.Title: German Author
quotes.Name: Gunter Grass

quotes.Text: On account of being a democracy and run by the people, we are the only nation in the world that has to keep a government four years, no matter what it does.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Will Rogers

quotes.Text: If you get to my age in life and nobody thinks well of you, I don't care how big your bank account is, your life is a disaster.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Warren Buffett

quotes.Text: Events will take their course, it is no good of being angry at them; he is happiest who wisely turns them to the best account.
quotes.Title: Greek Poet
quotes.Name: Euripides

quotes.Text: A human act once set in motion flows on forever to the great account. Our deathlessness is in what we do, not in what we are.
quotes.Title: English Novelist
quotes.Name: George Meredith

quotes.Text: Genius is rarely able to give any account of its own processes.
quotes.Title: English Philosopher
quotes.Name: George Henry Lewes

quotes.Text: Accounting was the course that helped me more than anything.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Julian Robertson

quotes.Text: Look at history. It's not the account of a species at peace.
quotes.Title: Indian Novelist
quotes.Name: Salman Rushdie

quotes.Text: Teams really take into account character.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Matt Cassel
